Package myAdapter

Class ListAdapter.SubList.SubListIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • myAdapter.ListAdapter.Iterator
      • myAdapter.ListAdapter.ListIterator
        • myAdapter.ListAdapter.SubList.SubListIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIterator, HListIterator
    Enclosing class:
    ListAdapter.SubList
    private class ListAdapter.SubList.SubListIterator
extends ListAdapter.ListIterator
    SubListIterator over a SubList object. It can traverse the vector associated with the SubList forwards and in reverse, perform adding, removing operations. Any change to the SubList will reflect into the original vector of ListAdapter.

    • Field Detail

      • from

        private int from
        Variable used to set a lower-bound to the navigation of a Vector. Useful for navigating any sublist, or list down to this bound.

      • to

        private int to
        Variable used to set an upper-bound to the navigation of a Vector. Useful for navigating any sublist, or list up to this bound.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubListIterator

        public SubListIterator​(java.util.Vector v,
                       int index,
                       int from,
                       int to)
        Constructor of a sub list iterator. Any changes through iteration will reflect on the original list.
        Parameters:
        v - the given Vector to iterate on.
        index - the starting index, bound between from and to.
        from - the lower bound.
        to - the upper bound.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(java.lang.Object o)
        Inserts the specified element into the sublist. The element is inserted immediately before the next element that would be returned by next, if any, and after the next element that would be returned by previous, if any. (If the sublist contains no elements, the new element becomes the sole element on the list.) The new element is inserted before the implicit cursor: a subsequent call to next would be unaffected, and a subsequent call to previous would return the new element. (This call increases by one the value that would be returned by a call to nextIndex or previousIndex.) Any element inserted will be visible by the original list.
        Specified by:
        add in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        add in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Parameters:
        o - the element to insert.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified element is null.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next would return an element rather than throwing an exception).
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface HIterator
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        hasNext in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        true if the list iterator has more elements when traversing the sublist in the forward direction.

      • hasPrevious

        public boolean hasPrevious()
        Returns true if this sublist iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the reverse direction. (In other words, returns true if previous would return an element rather than throwing an exception).
        Specified by:
        hasPrevious in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        hasPrevious in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        true if the list iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the reverse direction.

      • next

        public java.lang.Object next()
        Returns the next element in the sublist. This method may be called repeatedly to iterate through the sublist, or intermixed with calls to previous to go back and forth. (Note that alternating calls to next and previous will return the same element repeatedly).
        Specified by:
        next in interface HIterator
        Specified by:
        next in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        next in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        the next element in the sublist.
        Throws:
        myLib.NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no next element.

      • nextIndex

        public int nextIndex()
        Returns the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to next. (Returns sublist size if the list iterator is at the end of the sublist.)
        Specified by:
        nextIndex in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        nextIndex in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to next, or sublist size if the sublist iterator is at end of sublist.

      • previous

        public java.lang.Object previous()
        Returns the previous element in the sublist. This method may be called repeatedly to iterate through the sublist backwards, or intermixed with calls to next to go back and forth. (Note that alternating calls to next and previous will return the same element repeatedly.)
        Specified by:
        previous in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        previous in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        the previous element in the sublist.
        Throws:
        myLib.NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no previous element.

      • previousIndex

        public int previousIndex()
        Returns the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to previous. (Returns -1 if the list iterator is at the beginning of the sublist.)
        Specified by:
        previousIndex in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        previousIndex in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Returns:
        the index of the element that would be returned by a subsequent call to previous, or -1 if sublist iterator is at beginning of sublist.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes from the sublist the last element that was returned by next or previous. This call can only be made once per call to next or previous. It can be made only if SubListIterator.add has not been called after the last call to next or previous. Any element removed by this method will also be removed from the original list.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface HIterator
        Specified by:
        remove in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        remove in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - neither next nor previous have been called, or remove or add have been called after the last call to previous or previous.

      • set

        public void set​(java.lang.Object o)
        Replaces the last element returned by next or previous with the specified element. This call can be made only if neither ListIterator.remove nor ListIterator.add have been called after the last call to next or previous. Any object replaced by this method will be also replaced in the original list.
        Specified by:
        set in interface HListIterator
        Overrides:
        set in class ListAdapter.ListIterator
        Parameters:
        o - the element to insert.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if neither next nor previous have been called, or remove or add have been called after the last call to next or previous.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some aspect of the specified element prevents it from being added to this list.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element to be set is null.
